description:
Hi fun loving people,

We are few days before our coming meet-up event.
I guess it is a good idea to give you some information about it.

We are going to have a "speed meet-up",

Yes, a "speed meet-up"!!!!

I find that this is a great idea from Doug. You will meet him on Saturday if you don't know him yet.

Doug noticed, me too that during the last parties we had at my place there was so many nice people and we didn't have the chance to talk to all of the nice people that we really wanted to learn to know.

So this time we are going to give ourselves the chance to speak to 5 different people of our choice for 5-10 minutes each without being interupted buy other members.

So you will arrive, you look around and choose who you want to learn to know and when the "speed meet-up" starts you will have the chance to talk to the person of your choice for 5-10 long minutes.
I guess there will be a bell when your 5-10 minutes is over so you can move on to the next person of your choice.

Let's all find out how much fun it can be.

- To bring with you like always "fun spirit", drinks, lots of drinks if you like to drink a lot and some snacks, chips and cheese of your choice.

I will be providing breads and salades. If you want to bring some food, it is always very welcome.

See you all on Saturday 25th of April at 8 pm at my place.

After our "speed meet-up" we can always continue the night dancing or going to the Havana Club and also dancing. :)

We are looking forward to our "Speed Meet-up" event,

Till then enjoy the sunny day,

Bakoly

description:
Dear friends and new friends,

I hope you all are doing fine.
It is about time I give you guys an update information about our next meetup event.

Our last meetup at Havana was good, too much mojito's so let's go back to our usual meetup place,
so we can bring our own drinks and snacks.

The purpose stays the same "We will meet, we mingle and we make new friends" and above of all that,
we will have FUN.

To bring with you:
- your drinks and snacks
- your mingling mood
- 5 Euro


Looking forward to speed meetup with you!!!

Till then enjoy life,

Bakoly

Note: For those of you who might be unfamiliar with the concept of "speed meet up," the idea is to make everyone mix and meet. Too often we tend to talk to the people we already know. That's always good but you don't make many new friends that way. ;) So part of the evening we will set it up so you have to find your conversation partner and they have to find you. Everyone chats a few minutes with a randomly selected opposite and then we do it again. There will be plenty of time in between to visit with the people you already know, so no worries there. The idea is that by the end of the evening everyone should have met at least three new people as well as talked with the friends you already know.

Cheers
Doug

description:
Dear girls and dear guys,

As I already informed you on my previous email I had to look for a better location, since our last meetup event in April till now. There was one that Milko had to check and visit today, but after seeing the place he informed me that it was not any better than our usual location, and the rent is as much.

Since we all can go to different bars and clubs any time, for our meetup events I like to keep the idea of having a “private place” or “our own place” where "The Brussels new and not new in town meetup group" can meet and mingle, bring our own drinks and our own food, and last but not least have our own DJ.
Of course sometimes we will go to a bar or a restaurant but having our usual meeting location is very important.

So, till we find that better place, “our own place” I will have to postpone the 3 year anniversary celebration.
Beside, many members have also kindly asked me to postpone the 3 year celebration event, we have the whole year to do that.

If you have a suggestion or an idea on where or how we can do this please let me know.
Better location means more rent so we will have to pay more participation per person.

I just made a reservation at the Wild Geese, you will have the space at the back end of the pub, and if the weather is nice, you can enjoy the terasse. Ask for Farat, he will guide you to the other members.

We will meet, greet, mingle and make new friends, or/and strengthen our existing friendship.

Enjoy and have fun!!!

Unfortunally I will not be coming, neither Robert and Doug so you will be on your own.
Please make some pictures and send them to me.

And I am looking forward to seeing you all on our soon 3 year celebration event!

Missing you girls ... also guys...

A big smile and a big hug,
Bakoly

description:
Hello fun loving people,

It is about time I give you guys an update information about our next meetup event on Saturday, 12 March.

It has been a long while we didn't have any "speed meet-up" event, the last one some months ago, and it was a success.

So let's have a "speed meet-up"!!!! again.

To bring with you like always "your mingling mood", drinks, lots of drinks if you like to drink a lot, snacks of your choice.

After the speed-meetup there will be a dance workshop, Merengue, by Lilit and Julian. 

The purpose stays the same "We will meet, we mingle and we make new friends" and above of all that, 
we will have FUN.

To bring with you: 
- your drinks and snacks 
- your mingling mood,

- 10 Euro

- and your dancing mood

Always looking forward to having some fun time with you!!!

Till then enjoy life,

Bakoly

Note: For those of you who might be unfamiliar with the concept of "speed meet up," the idea is to make everyone mix and meet. Too often we tend to talk to the people we already know. That's always good but you don't make many new friends that way. ;) So part of the evening we will set it up so you have to find your conversation partner and they have to find you. Everyone chats a few minutes with a randomly selected opposite and then we do it again. There will be plenty of time in between to visit with the people you already know, so no worries there. The idea is that by the end of the evening everyone should have met at least three new people as well as talked with the friends you already know.

Cheers 
Doug
why: We want to have fun, to strengthen our existing friendship and to make new friends!!!!
how_to_find_us: We will be waiting for you there!!! :)

description:
Dear fun Meetupers,


I hope you all are doing fine. I am well, almost the week-end. Looking forward to a nice week-end away from Amsterdam. :)

I would like to announce that The Brussels New in Town Meetup Group will be 4 years old on the 3rd of May. So CONGRATULATIONS to you all, I mean to us members.
4 years ago we, I started the meetup with me myself and I, today we are 799 members and around 450 active members. On our biggest meetup event 86 members joined. So we can say we rock.!!! :)

We join The Brussels New in Town Meetup Group because we want to meet new, nice and interesting people and we want to have fun in a very relaxed atmosphere.

And of course we still make it happen.

We had lots of nice events, met lots of very nice and interesting people, made so many good friends. We have to celebrate that because we made it happen.

It is the celebration of our successful Meetup so if you have any suggestion on how to better celebrate our 4th anniversary then please let me know.

(ex: dressing up party, black and white, or 80's, or else)

We will celebrate our 4th year Anniversary on our coming Meetup Event on 7 May.


As usual we will bring:

- our fun (celebration) mood

- our drinks and snacks

- and 10 euro

I will bring a cake with 4 candles and the sparking wine. :)

Congratulations again to YOU all.
We had GREAT MEETUPS for 4 long years !!!
And of course we will have more. :)

See you all on Saturday 7 May at 20:00

Smile and hugs,
Bakoly

description:
Hi all,

One of our members is a stand up comedian, and he has a show next week Wednesday, shall we all go to his show?

Stand-up Comedy in English show on March 14, Brussels

Join us on Wednesday, March 14th for a special event.

A stand-up comedy show in English performed by 3 professional comedians starring Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) and two comedians from Canada - Joe Eagan and Daniel-Ryan Spaulding.

Nigel Williams is one of the biggest names in comedy in Belgian and sells out theatres and venues across the country with his one-man shows. Don't miss this chance to see this comedy superstar.

Daniel-Ryan Spaulding is a young, emerging stand-up comic on the international circuit who has performed in over 20 countries worldwide, including the Edinburgh Fringe, and headlining tours in Scandinavia, Central Europe, Asia & Australia. His comedy is provocative, flamboyant and smart, but always accessible.

Joe Eagan currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. He often travels around Europe performing for companies and international/expat groups with his comedy show about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour.

Everything will be in English.

When: Wed, Mar 14, showtime: 20.00

Where: Bouche-à-Oreille, Rue Félix Hap, 11, Brussels

How much: 17 euros (payable at the door from 19.00 onwards or advance tickets can be bought via https://ticketlib.com/8c9958c995ff8eadc722)

description:
Join us on Tuesday, October 23rd at Bouche-à-Oreille theater, from 19.00 onwards for a stand-up comedy show in English performed by 4 professional comedians starring Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) and Dave Thompson (UK) & two comedians from Canada and Holland - Joe Eagan and Jeroen Pater.


Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) is one of the biggest names in comedy in Belgian and Holland and sells out theatres and venues across the country with his one-man shows. Don't miss this chance to see this comedy superstar.

Dave Thompson (UK) has performed comedy for over 20 years and TV programmes such as ‘Harry Hill’s TV Burp’, and ‘The Sketch Show’ have commissioned Dave as a writer. Dave is best known as the person inside the Tinky Winky costume in ‘Teletubbies’, which is still shown all over the world.

Jeroen Pater (HOLL) is one of the foremost names in Dutch comedy and a godfather of the Utrecht comedy scene. Observational and twisted humour at its finest - he is a bit of a communications skills expert and we're looking forward to the magic he can work on the audience tonight.

Joe Eagan (CANADA) currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. He regularly tours throughout Benelux and Germany and talks about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss. He will be the host for the evening.

Christian Schulte-Loh (Germany) visited us in February and raised the roof so much that we just can't get enough of him. He is a comedy superstar and has performed all over the world. He hosts his own one-man show at the Edinburgh Fringe festival. He is known as one of the foremost foreign comedians on the UK comedy circuit and headlines clubs across Europeregularly.
Soula Notos (GRE) - Born and raised in Holland in a Greek family. Crisis indeed! She knows it by heart. Growing up with shouting and gesturing relatives (small bodies, lots of movement), the only relief was comedy. And now, close to her well deserved pension, she loves to tell stories filled with self-mockery to as many people as possible. She has performed at the Free Fringe in Edinburgh, in Manchester, at the International Women’s Festival in Greece and many clubs and venues across Europe. "Great Energy. Completely original." - Funny's Funny Comedian of the Year 2011 Highly Commended Act.
Louis Zezeran (AUS) - runs clubs in Finland and organized the very first Stand Up Comedy shows in Estonia, using the cleverly named title “Comedy Estonia”. Louis has a like-able connection with the audience when he performs. He often talks to the audience, making jokes with the crowd and letting them become part of the action. Louis likes to make fun of cultural differences, and have a poke at everyone.
Stewart Johnson (USA) - has a knack for picking out the obvious yet hidden quirks in society and turning them into laughs you will never forget. He is an American who is based in Estonia, and has a more mainstream, non-offensive style, frequently drawing upon his experiences as a father. A witty, observational style that will tickle every single one of your funny bones.
Hosted by Joe Eagan(CAN)
Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmay(save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)
When: Tues, May 21. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00
Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)
name: Let's go to another great Brussels Comedy Night show!

description:
Hi all,

It is about time we meetup and mingle again!

Taking this occasion too, to wish you a happy New year, it is never too late! :)

I wish you, your family and friends health, love and happiness for this new year 2013.

Let's make 2013 just better than last year!

Let's have more fun and make new friends!

The details of our next event will be updated soon.

If you have a nice suggestion, just let me know, and we will make it happen.

Till then take care and enjoy life.

 

All the very best for 2013,

And see you soon.

Smile,

Bakoly

description:
Welcome to next english Comedy Night!! On Tuesday, Feb 18th, we'll have a fine evening of international standup comedy with great comedians from around the world.

Le Bouche À Oreille

Rue Felix Hap, 11, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

Tickets : 20€ in presale, 25€ at the door.

Presale tickets via: https://ticketlib.chilipost.io/standupfeb


Damian Clark (Australia) - Damian burst into the UK & European comedy circuit in 2005 and within weeks was hailed ‘The Number 1 event to see’ and ‘Cream of the crop’. After several acclaimed TV performances in Australia plus two prestigious comedy awards under his belt, Damian moved to Ireland where teaming up with fellow comic Andrew Stanley, he wrote and co-starred in RTE TV’s I Dare Ya which was the highest rating debut of an Irish TV comedy show to date. 

Tiernan Douieb (UK) - Comedian, writer and occasional mixer of herbal tea bags, his solo Edinburgh show in 2011 'Tiernan Douieb vs The World' received rave reviews. Tiernan is also known as one of the best MCs on the UK circuit and we are very fortunate to have him guest the show in Brussels tonight as a guest MC. 

Otto Kuhnle (GER) - Berlin-based Otto Kuhnle is a prime example of a versatile German entertainer and actor. He sings, dances, juggles, plays several instruments, does magic tricks and more. A legend in Germany and having made quite a name for himself on the UK circuit, we are honoured to have him grace our stage this evening. 

Eric Seufert (USA) – Since moving to Europe, Eric helped found Comedy Estonia, the first English-language comedy club in the former Soviet Union. Stand-up isn’t Eric’s only comedic outlet; he has trained in improv with the Upright Citizens Brigade (NYC) and Coldtowne Theater (Austin, TX) and written for such magazines as the Austinst, Political Derby, and Cracked.com. Eric currently lives and runs a comedy club in Berlin.

Els Vertongen (BEL) - One of the top rising stars in Europe, she is fresh of her New Act Competition win in Antwerp and primed for a stellar career in comedy. The talk of the town in Antwerp, we can't wait to see what she has in store for us in Brussels.


- Pasta corner from 7 PM onward

- entrance through place Van Meyel - http://goo.gl/maps/T337D

- mandatory coatcheck, but free of charge
how_to_find_us: Rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels, Brussels
name: Brussels English Comedy Night - Tues Feb 18

group.name: The Brussels New and not New in Town Meetup Group

description:
Welcome to next english Comedy Night!! On Tuesday, March 18th, we'll have a fine evening of international standup comedy with great comedians from around the world.


Bob Maclaren (NZ) 

Bob is born in New Zealand and a resident of Amsterdam. He has delighted every corner of the world with his laconic and surprising comedy. A combination of kiwi isolation and the lurid madness of Benelux gives Bob a refreshingly unusual view of life as he sees it. A storyteller extraordinaire with a body language that can be best described as mildly unhinged; his routines have been televised on every continent. A superbly visual performer with razor sharp observations, Bob’s stand up has seen him grace the stages of Montreal, London, Amsterdam and every other corner of the planet.


Dan Gagnon (Can)

A canadian born radio and tv host turned stand-up comedian in the French part of Belgium, Dan Gagnon has filled the Royal Circus in Brussels with his first show two years ago. He is now hosting the 'Dan late Show' on RTBF, belgian national TV. This expat who spent the last ten years in Belgium is just starting to do comedy in English. 


Caroline Clifford (GB)

Caroline is from England where she reached the final of the prestigious So You Think You're Funny, Amused Moose and Funny Women competitions. She now lives in Berlin where she co-hosts the incredibly popular We Are Not Gemüsed comedy show Neukölln confessional and Mode7. She is known for her fast wit, dark surreal and imaginative sense of humour. 


Drew Portnoy (USA)

Drew traded the mountains of Colorado for the Berlin nightlife over a decade ago. He aims his dry humor and sharp tongue at his biggest enemies: his children and Germans. He performs in both English and German and was a finalist in Berlin-based Quatsch Comedy Club's prestigious annual Talentschmiede competition. He recently acted in a comedy pilot for German TV and won NPR Berlin's 2014 storytelling competition.


Gerrit De Bremme (Bel)

Gerrit is an up and coming talent on the Belgian circuit and a man of IT by day. Probably the only comic in Europe with a decent day job, he has lots to tell about the shenanigans that go on at work, and at home in his lovely big house with his girlfriend in the countryside - a successful Belgian in every sense of the word. 


Joe Eagan (CAN)

Joe currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. Founder of InternationalComedians.com, he is also very much a ‘behind the scenes’ kind of guy, organizing and co-organizing countless shows throughout Europe. On stage, he specializes in entertaining crowds with his unique perspective about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss! He is back as host for the evening this month! 

check out our promo clip to see what the comedy evenings are like: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TtvEEewmz_g


Tickets : 20€ in presale, 

http://tinyurl.com/bxlmarch18-2014


25€ at the door.

where: 

Le Bouche À Oreille


Rue Felix Hap, 11, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

and as usual :

- Pasta corner from 7 PM onward

- entrance through place Van Meyel

- mandatory vestiaire, but free of charge

description:
Join us for another fantastic Brussels English comedy night on tues, april 15th.

The entire show will be in English.

Find fellow group members: there will be meetup signs on some tables in the room to the left of the bar

(save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

Tickets online here:

https://ticketlib.chilipost.io/april2014

When: Tues, Apr 15. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00

Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)

see the promo video of the club here: 


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TtvEEewmz_g

Comics: 

Isak Jansson SWE
Isak Jansson is one of Sweden’s top international comedy acts. He has spread Swedish comedy all over the world in places like Russia, India, South Africa, Finland, France, Germany, Belgium, UK, Estonia, China, etc. His comedy style mixes observational comedy with an absurdist touch, all in a high energy physical stage persona. In 2013 he toured with his solo show "It´s the Flourist’s Fault". 

Brian Jordan USA
Brian is an American based in Sweden. He has seen the best of the best live at the famous Punchline in Atlanta, but Brian has developed his own style of storytelling comedy. They say that part truth is involved in most comedians’ stories, and Brian is no different. If you figure out which parts of his stories are true, they could shock you. He has been in commercials, lent his voice for audiobooks, and is looking forward to his first movie role, should one come along.

Claus Reiss DK
Best Bagpipe Comedy Show in Europe...…and the only one. The Danish comedian Claus Reiss is the only man in Europe who also entertains with the bagpipe. He uses the odd instrument to play well-known tunes, but in a most untraditional way. He spices up his performance with storytelling and jokes in a close interaction with the audience. Claus Reiss has been on the international comedy circuit for several years now attending some of the world’s biggest comedy festivals. His shows have made people laugh across Europe due to his surprising mixture of bagpipe music, comedy and improvisation.

Manu Moreau BEL
Is he a bird, is he a plane? Well, if he’s up that high, he must be insane! From a small township to the big city, he’s been there, done that and sold the t-shirt. His first steps in comedy weren’t so long ago, but every step since has been closely monitored for your safety. His comedy works similar to cocaine: one line after the other, very addictive.

Soula Notos GRE
Originally from Greece, but now based in Utrecht, she has fantastic energy on stage and a quick-wittedness only to adore and admire. Soula will be our host this evening and we can't wait to welcome her on stage to MC the show. 

Entrance through Place Van Meyel

Pasta corner on site too if you are hungry.

name: Brussels English Comedy Night - Tues Apr 15 - Isak Jansson Swe & More

description:
English Comedy Night, May 20, 2014, with a superstar headliner that has received prestigious reviews and won many awards, Mr Tony Law (Can).

The entire show will be in English.

(save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

Tickets online here:

When: Tues, Apr 15. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00

Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)

tickets are 20€ in presale, 25€ on site.

presale tickets via: http://ticketlib.com/may2014

Tony Law (CAN)


Tony is a surreal and unique stand-up comedian, who looks like a cross between a 1908 Olympic athlete and – his words – a 16th century Genoese sailor. His TV appearances include Never Mind The Buzzcocks, Stewart Lee’s Comedy Vehicle and Have I Got News For You. He is known for his highly surreal material and delivery, and 1950s Americana style of dress, favouring boots with turned-up jeans and a Viking/explorer style of hair.


Ahmed Berhan (SWE)

This African Swedish comedian is all energy and one of the foremost booked comics on the Scandinavian circuit, including a regular on the well-known Raw stage in Stockholm. His comedy is full of action and using all the stage, and his liveliness and quick-witted nature will leave you gasping for air between laughs.


David Hayden (IRE)

David Hayden is an Irish Comedian Based in Antwerp Belgium. He was shortlisted for BBC New Comedy Awards 2012 and Finalist for “Show me the funny 2011” Winner of (the much coveted) Battle of the Axe - Ha’ Penny Bridge Inn - Dublin 2010. He moved to Belgium in 2011 and started the “Cafe Manger Saturday Night Comedy “ where he MCs and presents local and International acts. He has supported some of the best comedians in Belgium, Ireland, Germany and the UK. As well as a regular on the Belgian Circuit he also brings English Speaking stand up comedy to Belgian schools.


Jeroen Pater (NL)

Jeroen is one of the foremost names in Dutch comedy and known as the godfather of the Utrecht comedy scene. Observational and twisted humour at its finest - he is a bit of a communications skills expert and we're looking forward to the magic he can work on the audience tonight.


Hosted by Joe Eagan (CAN)

Joe currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. Founder of InternationalComedians.com, he is also very much a ‘behind the scenes’ kind of guy, organizing and co-organizing countless shows throughout Europe. On stage, he specializes in entertaining crowds with his unique perspective about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss!

Entrance through Place Van Meyel


Pasta corner on site, cheap and tasty !

www.facebook.com/standupbrussels

Join us on Tuesday, September 16th for the first Brussels English Comedy Night of the season. We have a great new season with lots of fantastic acts! We also have a new venue! 

When: Tues, Sept 16, Showtime: 20.00

(map: https://goo.gl/maps/F3wkL)

Advance tickets: 16 eur (available via: http://ticketlib.com/sept2014) 

Door Entry: 20 eur

Headlining this show is the incredible Benny Boot (Australia). Benny has been performing on the UK stand-up comedy circuit for over 8 years. He delivers his jokes in a unique style on variety of strange topics. His engaging persona & material keeps the laughter rolling through the entire show and is guaranteed to bring any audience undone. Edinburgh Festival (Pleasance Comedy Reserve - 2007; Just the Tonic Showcase - 2006); NBC’s Last Comic Standing (UK Finalist).

Also performing: Zeid Andersson (Sweden) - One of Scandinavia's top female comics, she won the One-liner of the year award in 2012 at the Stockholm Comedy Awards and is a member of the famous "A little damn women's movement" show.

Neil Robinson (Canada) Niel is one of the brightest future talents in Europe.

Jason Waddell (USA) - Taking Belgium by storm, this American, IT nerd by day, and experimental comic is an up and coming star of tomorrow. 

& your host Joe Eagan (Canada).

description:
* * * *

* * * *

Join us on Tuesday, oct 21 for the next Brussels English Comedy Night of the season with superstar Phil Nichol (CAN) + 4 other comics.

When: Tues, Oct 21, Showtime: 20.00

Where: The Black Sheep, Chaussée de Boondael 8, Brussels 

(map: https://goo.gl/maps/F3wkL)

Advance tickets: 16 eur (available via: http://ticketlib.com/oct2014

Door Entry: 20 eur

Connect to each other: if you want to connect to each other, bring a smartphone! Culti Arjan will be online to help you connecting to each other :)  

Phil Nichol (Canada) is a truly unique performer. An acclaimed actor, award winning comedian, producer, presenter, writer and musician there is no end to his talent. Phil is an energetic and exciting performer with an unquenchable thirst to break boundaries and innovate with his work. His skill as an improviser whether it be musical, comedy or straight is unparalled. With a surreal edge to some of his mischievous rantings Nichol always brings something new to the stage, his keen sense of fun and eye for the shocking and absurd has cemented his position as one of the best comedians on the circuit today. His assured and award winning performances in his theatrical work have attracted critical accolades and see him in great demand as an actor.

SCOTSMAN FRINGE FIRST WINNER 2011; TIME OUT BEST COMEDY PERFORMER 1998

“You won‟t see many comedy shows that actually exert g-force. But if you‟re a passion junkie like me, there is no better place to get your fix than from Phil Nichol…exhilarating, incredibly funny and clever” The Scotsman

John Gilligan (USA) is a Las Vegas based comic who brings observational humor to new heights, with a very down to earth spin. He touches on subjects including a 25 year career in construction, being raised by 2 NY Police Officers, his military service during the cold war, hospitalization, and he claims to understand the female mind. Enjoy while he lays it on the line in proof of the old adage, "Tragedy + Time = Comedy"

Emma Wessleus (Sweden) was one of the fastest rising stars in Sweden before she moved to Amsterdam recently to pursue comedy and performing arts. We are honoured to have her join us for her first ever performance in Belgium. Truly a great Scandinavian talent not to miss!

+ our bonus new talent act this evening will be Juan Bayet (Colombia). 

& your host - Hank (NL) is one of the foremost hosts on the European circuit today. Don't miss this change to see this legend in action as he walks you through the evening and promises endless chuckles and giggles along the way.

Mark your calendars for our November 18 show too, same time, same place, 4 more comedians from around the world, including superstars Al Pitcher NZ and Ria Lina UK.

 presented by English Comedy Brussels and InternationalComedians.com

www.englishcomedybrussels.com

Hire comics for events/parties: www.internationalcomedians.com 

<a href="http://www.internationalcomedians.com/"></a>
